tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SecurityPatches (
  patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  software_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  patch_description TEXT,
  patch_date DATE,
  compliance_standard VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE security_patches (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    software_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    patch_version VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    patch_description TEXT,
    release_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE regulatory_compliance (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    software_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    compliance_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    compliance_status VARCHAR(20),
    compliance_deadline DATE
);

CREATE TABLE software_applications (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    app_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    developer VARCHAR(100),
    app_version VARCHAR(20),
    last_updated DATE
);

CREATE TABLE patch_compliance (
    patch_id INT,
    standard_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (patch_id, standard_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (patch_id) REFERENCES security_patches(patch_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (standard_id) REFERENCES compliance_standards(standard_id)
);
